title: SaveAs Forgets the file type
description: When using the SaveAs function, the file type is not remembered. Additionally, the icon for the file has changed from the parent java file icon to a generic file icon.
OB: 1) Open an existing java file. 2) Make a modification to the file (e.g. move an existing class). 3) Click on the SaveAs icon located next to the Save icon. A dialog box will appear. 4) Browse for a valid container location. 5) Type the filename without providing the file extension, as it is not requested. 6) Click Ok. Observe that the file is added to the specified location in the Navigator, but no file extension is displayed.
EB: The file is now considered a generic file, as opening it will display its content as plain text. Expected Behavior: The file should be saved with the same file extension as the original file, unless it is explicitly changed.
